questions.question_text: What objects can be cloned within Snowflake? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
its A and E.

Internal (i.e. Snowflake) named stages cannot be cloned.

Selected Answer: AE
Internal named stages are already included under schemas since stages are child of schemas. Therefore A & E

Selected Answer: AD
CREATE <object> â€¦ CLONE
Creates a copy of an existing object in the system. This command is primarily used for creating zero-copy clones of databases, schemas, and tables; however, it can also be used to quickly/easily create clones of other schema objects , such as external stages, file formats, and sequences, and database roles.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/object-clone

Selected Answer: AD
A& D, not E

questions.question_text: What can be used to process unstructured data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Snowflake supports the following features to help you process unstructured data:
1. External Function
2. User defined functions and Stored procedures

External functions allow you to call external services/APIs to process unstructured data
Useful for tasks like text analysis, image processing, or other complex transformations

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer

questions.question_text: Which type of workload is recommended for Snowpark-optimized virtual warehouses?

choices.C: Workloads with unpredictable data volumes for each query
choices.D: Workloads that are queried with small table scans and selective filters
choices.B: Workloads that have large memory requirements
Add a clustering key to the table.
choices.D: Add a Dynamic Data Masking policy to the table.
choices.A: Create a view on the table.
choices.C: Add a LIMIT clause to the query.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Adding a clustering key would improve the depth and, in turn, pruning efficiency.

How should this query be optimized?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AB are correct
